item.title: Quantitative Analyst at Flutter
item.description: I am delighted to share that I am starting a new role as Quantitative Analyst at Flutter UKI .

item.title: CPD Certificate AI
item.description: From August-October 2022, I took part in a Continuing Professional Development course in Foundations in Artificial Intelligence from the Faculty of Computing, Digital and Data School of Computer Science, Technological University Dublin.

item.title: Meteorologist at Met Éireann
item.description: In October 2022, I was promoted at Met Éireann to the role of Machine Learning Meteorologist.

item.title: A coupled electrochemomechanical model for the cycling of a Cu15Si4-hosted silicon nanowire
item.description: My latest work has been published in the Journal of Power Sources.

item.title: Postdoctoral researcher at Met Éireann
item.description: In October 2021, I begun a new research position at Met Éireann .

item.title: A validated asymptotic thermomechanical model for air-gap formation in tapered moulds in the continuous casting of steel

item.title: Postdoctoral researcher Si-Drive, UL
item.description: In 2020, I begun a postdoctoral research role in MACSI, Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of LimerickL, researching nanowire technology in lithium ion battery anodes as part of the Si-Drive consortium.

item.title: Analysis of a model for the formation of fold-type oscillation marks in the continuous casting of steel
item.description: My latest work has been published in the IMA Journal of Applied Mathematics.

item.title: PhD Graduation
item.description: In February 2020, I completed my PhD thesis. My PhD study was on mathematical modelling of continuous steel casting.

item.title: About
item.description: I currently work as a Quantitative Analyst for Flutter UKI, using mathematical and statistical modelling, machine learning and software development to make predictions in sport.

item.title: Contact
item.description: If you wish to contact me, use the icon links to my social channels and email.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.description: Thumbnails can be enabled easily by setting the thumbnail parameter in the frontmatter to an image such as "images/landscape.
